channel.title: CVE Feed for Apple -- Safari
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apple -- Safari

item.title: CVE-2020-3833|2024-08-04T07:44:51.383Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: An inconsistent user interface issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Safari 13.0.5. Visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing.

item.title: CVE-2020-9784|2024-08-04T10:43:05.080Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in Safari 13.1. A malicious iframe may use another websiteâ€™s download settings.

item.title: CVE-2020-9987|2024-08-04T10:50:57.436Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: An inconsistent user interface issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Safari 14.0. Visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing.

item.title: CVE-2020-9948|2024-08-04T10:50:56.252Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A type confusion issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 14.0. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9801|2024-08-04T10:43:04.977Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in Safari 13.1.1. A malicious process may cause Safari to launch an application.

item.title: CVE-2020-9912|2024-08-04T10:43:05.572Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in Safari 13.1.2. A malicious attacker may be able to change the origin of a frame for a download in Safari Reader mode.

item.title: CVE-2020-9983|2024-08-04T10:50:57.422Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in Safari 14.0. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9860|2024-08-04T10:43:05.472Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A custom URL scheme handling issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in Safari 13.0.5. Processing a maliciously crafted URL may lead to arbitrary javascript code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9951|2024-08-04T10:50:57.013Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in Safari 14.0. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9942|2024-08-04T10:50:56.250Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: An inconsistent user interface issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.0.1, Safari 13.1.2. Visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing.

item.title: CVE-2020-3852|2024-08-04T07:44:51.248Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in Safari 13.0.5. A URL scheme may be incorrectly ignored when determining multimedia permission for a website.

item.title: CVE-2023-42956|2024-08-02T19:37:22.630Z -- apple -- safari
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 17.2, iOS 17.2 and iPadOS 17.2, macOS Sonoma 14.2. Processing web content may lead to a denial-of-service.
